clinical_study.brief_title: Chlorhexidine Disk for Prevention of Exit-site Infection in Peritoneal Dialysis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Chlorhexidine-impregnated Sponge Dressing for Prevention of Catheter Exit Site Infection in Incident Peritoneal Dialysis Patients - a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of chlorhexidine-impregnated disk in preventing catheter exit-site infection in peritoneal dialysis patients

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary aim of the study is to examine the exit-site infection rate in patients using chlorhexidine-impregnated dressing.
The participant will be followed up at 2, 6, 12, 24, 36 and 52 weeks of study and during each visit the catheter exit-site will be examined by one of the investigators for any sign of infection or allergic reaction, and questionnaires about satisfaction with use of study material (biopatch) will be asked by a study team member at the 12 week visit of the study. Each participant will be followed up for one year.

primary_outcome.description: Exit-site/tunnel infection rate (reported as episodes per patient-year) in patients receiving chlorhexidine-impregnated disk

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to the first episode of exit-site/tunnel infection
secondary_outcome.description: days from peritoneal dialysis initiation to the time develops first exit-site/tunnel infection
Peritonitis rate (reported as episodes per patient-year) in patients receiving chlorhexidine-impregnated disk

secondary_outcome.measure: time to first episode of peritonitis
secondary_outcome.description: days from peritoneal dialysis initiation to the time develops first episode of peritonitis
Hospitalization due to peritoneal dialysis-related infection
technique failure is defined as transfer to hemodialysis for >= 30 days
any local or systemic adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: patient satisfaction with the use of chlorhexidine-impregnated sponge dressing
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaires related to the treatment with chlorhexidine-impregnated disk

secondary_outcome.measure: comparison of the above outcomes with historical cohort using topical antibiotics cream
secondary_outcome.description: comparison of exit-site/tunnel infection rate, peritonitis rate, time to first episode of exit-site/tunnel infection or peritonitis, technique failure rate, hospitalization rate, adverse events, mortality with historical cohort patients using topical gentamicin cream

clinical_study.condition: Peritoneal Dialysis Catheter Exit Site Infection

arm_group.description: The chlorhexidine-impregnated disk, will be applied to the peritoneal dialysis catheter exit-site and the disk will be changed once a week

intervention.description: The chlorhexidine-impregnated sponge, named biopatch, is a protective disk (2.5 cm x 0.7 cm), which is hydrophilic polyurethane absorptive foam with chlorhexidine gluconate, in average of 86.8mg per disk

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All adult incident peritoneal dialysis patients between 21 to 90 years old, who are followed up in Singapore General Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
1. patients who have known history of allergy to chlorhexidine
2. patients who had previous history of peritoneal dialysis catheter exit-site infection
3. patients with mentally challenging conditions who are unable to give the valid consent for the study
4. patients who have been involved in another study for exit site infection
